snippet.title: 'Luftrausers' Review (PC, Mac, PlayStation 3, PS Vita) - Raus Party
snippet.description: Luftrausers, a hardcore, retro-styled physics-based shooter, puts the player in the cockpit of one of over a hundred possible buildouts of an experimental combat jet launched by a Ruritanian enemy against overwhelming. Using torpedoes, missiles, lasers or good old-fashioned giant, slow-moving arcade-game bullets, your mission is to kill, and kill, [...] read »

snippet.title: Mad Catz FREQ 4D Gaming Headphones With ViviTouch Review
snippet.description: I've been a vocal evangelist for ViviTouch, a new haptic technology which elevates audio to crazy levels of immersion. Now Mad Catz has the distinction of being the first company to bring the technology to retail via their F.R.E.Q. 4D headphones. Do they deliver the magic? read »

snippet.title: Radeon R9 295X2 Review: AMD Delivers On A Promise With Exciting Liquid-Cooled GPU
snippet.description: With the liquid cooled Radeon R9 295x2, AMD has delivered an exciting 4K-capable graphics card for PC gaming enthusiasts. They're also delivering on some important promises. read »

snippet.title: 'Out There' Review (iOS, Android) - Roguelikelike Lost In Space
snippet.description: Out there, by the French studio mi-clos, offers a solitary, existential and attractively simple vision of being lost in deep space. Can its quiet charms keep players hooked? read »

snippet.title: MSI GT60 2PE Dominator Pro Gaming Laptop Review: A $2,500 PC-Killer With An Ultra HD Screen
snippet.description: Gaming laptops can represent something of a false economy. Compared to desktops, gamers generally get far less performance per buck for the simple reason so much more time and effort goes in to cramming some seriously powerful hardware into such a small place. However, there are still plenty of reasons you [...] read »

snippet.title: 'World Of Warplanes' Review (PC)
snippet.description: Video The free-to-play MMO World of Warplanes is the high-flying follow-up to Wargaming’s World of Tanks. World of Warplanes continues the trend of placing players in historically accurate weapons of war, with faster-paced combat than Tanks and a progression system that allows players to build up an expansive hangar of highly customizable [...] read »

snippet.title: 'Titanfall' Review (Xbox One): The Iron Giant
snippet.description: VideoSpeed. It's been missing from the competitive FPS genre since the days of Quake. Call of Duty lets you sprint for mere seconds at a time. Gears of War has you run only when it leads to hiding behind a wall. Halo allows more mobility in the form of a power-armor [...] read »

snippet.title: 'South Park: The Stick of Truth' Review
snippet.description: It's the most disgusting, deliberately offensive mass-market video game ever made... and also a joy to play.

snippet.title: 'Diablo 3: Reaper of Souls' Review: Through The Fire And Flames
snippet.description: VideoThe release of Diablo 3's expansion, Reaper of Souls, represents the culmination of what might be one of the most dramatic quality turnarounds in gaming history. When the original Diablo 3 launched, though it improved on some aspects of its immortal predecessor, it was mostly heralded as a huge disappointment. Loot, [...]

snippet.title: It's Actually Cheaper To Buy Digital Storm's New Gaming PC Than To Build It Yourself
snippet.description: In a sure sign that the world is ending -- or that perhaps a boutique PC vendor is actually making use of economies of scale to benefit their customers -- Digital Storm's newly released Vanquish II gaming rig is cheaper to buy off the shelf than it is to build yourself. read »
